overview_of_class:
Models of service systems, current practices in early intervention, legislation, infant development processes, and risk factors. Emphasis on individual family service planning, assessment, and intervention.

Course Description: This course will address the following areas concerned with early intervention of developmentally delayed/disabled or at risk infants and toddlers and their families: historical overview of the field and pertinent legislation, normal development in infants and toddlers, risk factors and potential outcomes, family roles, reactions and participation in the delivery of service, models of early intervention services, intervention teams and roles and responsibilities of the team members, specialized techniques for assessment and early intervention, and efficacy of service.
name: Early Communication Intervention With Infants and Toddlers
subject: CSD
